issue.title: Fix CPT URL Rewrites
issue.body:
## Tasks

- [x] I have signed a [Contributor License Agreement (CLA)](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs#contributor-license-agreement) with WP Engine.
- [x] If a code change, I have written testing instructions that the whole team & outside contributors can understand.
- [x] I have written and included a comprehensive [changeset](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/blob/canary/DEVELOPMENT.md#deployment) to properly document the changes I've made.

## Description

When the option "Enable Post and Category URL rewrites" is turned on currently there is no check for any custom post types. This feature will currently only work on the default pages & posts.

## Testing

On addition of the one line we can see all the CPTs rewritten correctly!

comment.body: @dana-blackbean thank you for this PR and apologies for the delay. We'll get this merged soon.

release.name: @faustwp/wordpress-plugin@1.1.0
release.body:
### Minor Changes

-   c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside `wp-blocks` folder. Then run `faust blockset` to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blocks will be available in the editor.

-   d3d30aa: Added support for authenticated WPGraphQL introspection queries using FAUST_SECRET_KEY. It is no longer required to enable "Public Introspection" in WPGraphQL.

Minor Changes

  • c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside wp-blocks folder. Then run faust blockset to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blo…

- [Changelog](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/release.js)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: next
  dependency-type: direct:production
...

pull_request.title: Version Packages
pull_request.body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to canary, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @faustwp/cli@1.2.0

### Minor Changes

-   c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside `wp-blocks` folder. Then run `faust blockset` to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blocks will be available in the editor.

-   d3d30aa: Added support for authenticated WPGraphQL introspection queries using FAUST_SECRET_KEY. It is no longer required to enable "Public Introspection" in WPGraphQL.

### Patch Changes

-   03ee9e8: Bug Fix: Forces cli blockset command to use @wordpress/scripts package.

## @faustwp/block-editor-utils@0.0.5

### Patch Changes

-   604e9e3: Update block-editor-utils dependencies.

## @faustwp/core@1.2.0

### Patch Changes

-   3722ab3: Fix `x-using` header not appearing when i18n options are set in `next.config.js`

## @faustwp/wordpress-plugin@1.1.0

### Minor Changes

-   c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside `wp-blocks` folder. Then run `faust blockset` to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blocks will be available in the editor.

-   d3d30aa: Added support for authenticated WPGraphQL introspection queries using FAUST_SECRET_KEY. It is no longer required to enable "Public Introspection" in WPGraphQL.

pull_request.title: Version Packages
pull_request.body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to canary, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @faustwp/cli@1.2.0

### Minor Changes

-   c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside `wp-blocks` folder. Then run `faust blockset` to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blocks will be available in the editor.

-   d3d30aa: Added support for authenticated WPGraphQL introspection queries using FAUST_SECRET_KEY. It is no longer required to enable "Public Introspection" in WPGraphQL.

### Patch Changes

-   03ee9e8: Bug Fix: Forces cli blockset command to use @wordpress/scripts package.

## @faustwp/block-editor-utils@0.0.5

### Patch Changes

-   604e9e3: Update block-editor-utils dependencies.

## @faustwp/core@1.2.0

### Patch Changes

-   3722ab3: Fix `x-using` header not appearing when i18n options are set in `next.config.js`

## @faustwp/wordpress-plugin@1.1.0

### Minor Changes

-   c29f83d: Add blockset command in @faust/cli and faustwp plugin.

    Add your blocks inside `wp-blocks` folder. Then run `faust blockset` to compile and upload the blocks into WordPress. Blocks will be available in the editor.

-   d3d30aa: Added support for authenticated WPGraphQL introspection queries using FAUST_SECRET_KEY. It is no longer required to enable "Public Introspection" in WPGraphQL.

pull_request.title: Fix deploy to wordpress.org workflow
pull_request.body:
## Tasks

- [ ] I have signed a [Contributor License Agreement (CLA)](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs#contributor-license-agreement) with WP Engine.
- [ ] If a code change, I have written testing instructions that the whole team & outside contributors can understand.
- [ ] I have written and included a comprehensive [changeset](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/blob/canary/DEVELOPMENT.md#deployment) to properly document the changes I've made.

## Description

This PR fixes the `if` statement when versioning packages/deploying the WordPress plugin to wordpress.org. 

![Screenshot 2023-10-24 at 9 06 09 PM](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/5946219/c13003b4-5109-4925-8730-0217b1baffd4)

These changes were confirmed in a test repo available here:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test

You can see the test version packages action results in the repo here that confirm that the variables are set properly, and that the if statement functions as expected:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test/actions/runs/6634836225/job/18024831461

Additionally, here is the test/example workflow file:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test/blob/main/.github/workflows/release.yml

<!--
Include a summary of the change and some contextual information.
-->

## Related Issue(s):

<!--
Provide the GitHub issue(s) number for issue tracking purposes, use the following syntax:

- #1234
-->

## Testing

<!--
Describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce. Also list any relevant details for your test configuration such as how to test the changes locally or in staging.
-->

## Screenshots

<!--
If this is a visual change include relevant screenshots about the behavior of the application before and after this change.
-->

## Documentation Changes

<!--
List corresponding changes to the documentation.
-->

## Dependant PRs

<!--
List any dependent PR's that are awaiting review. Use the following syntax:

- #1234
-->

issue.body:
Bumps [next](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) from 12.3.4 to 13.4.20-canary.13.
Commits
  • fe191f8 v13.4.20-canary.13
  • 8b4bb03 Fixes for Turbopack HMR (#54790)
  • 7744aa2 Update list of Next.js options in next.rs (#54798)
  • f36ad4c Remove experimental.pageEnv (#54789)
  • 0e1c85c Remove additional appDir checks (#54788)
  • 1aab5ee (Example) Update with-segment-analytics to use segmentio/analytics-next and a...
  • 0f07cf5 chore: verify missing/invalid/private reproduction links (#54724)
  • 962ce0d Short circut 404's for /favicon.ico in development (#54747)
  • 3fbbfeb Remove experimental.appDir as it's stable (#54785)
  • f567aaf Add @visx/visx to the import optimization list (#54778)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=next&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=12.3.4&new-version=13.4.20-canary.13)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. issue.title: Fix deploy to wordpress.org workflow
issue.body:
## Tasks

- [ ] I have signed a [Contributor License Agreement (CLA)](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs#contributor-license-agreement) with WP Engine.
- [ ] If a code change, I have written testing instructions that the whole team & outside contributors can understand.
- [ ] I have written and included a comprehensive [changeset](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/blob/canary/DEVELOPMENT.md#deployment) to properly document the changes I've made.

## Description

This PR fixes the `if` statement when versioning packages/deploying the WordPress plugin to wordpress.org. 

![Screenshot 2023-10-24 at 9 06 09 PM](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/5946219/c13003b4-5109-4925-8730-0217b1baffd4)

These changes were confirmed in a test repo available here:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test

You can see the test version packages action results in the repo here that confirm that the variables are set properly, and that the if statement functions as expected:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test/actions/runs/6634836225/job/18024831461

Additionally, here is the test/example workflow file:

https://github.com/blakewilson/deploy-wp-changesets-test/blob/main/.github/workflows/release.yml

issue.title: fix: term_link filter
issue.body:
## Description

This fixes the term_link filter callback to not modify the term link urls for GraphQL requests. 

## Related Issue(s):

fixes: #1613

## Testing

#### BEFORE:

Term uri is absolute in the GraphQL Response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 51 51](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/bd81fe0e-8978-4374-968c-c4c7c76cd6f1)


#### AFTER:

The term uri is relative in the GraphQL response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 00](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/910f50ec-ae1b-4333-be84-0db538e95a99)

But in the admin UIs the term links are absolute with the alternate Faust front-end domain.

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 20](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/7e0b2d94-477e-4913-835b-bb95cc2560a6)

comment.body: @jasonbahl if you don't mind. I've never seen this bug before!

issue.title: fix: term_link filter
issue.body:
## Description

This fixes the term_link filter callback to not modify the term link urls for GraphQL requests. 

## Related Issue(s):

fixes: #1613

## Testing

#### BEFORE:

Term uri is absolute in the GraphQL Response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 51 51](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/bd81fe0e-8978-4374-968c-c4c7c76cd6f1)


#### AFTER:

The term uri is relative in the GraphQL response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 00](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/910f50ec-ae1b-4333-be84-0db538e95a99)

But in the admin UIs the term links are absolute with the alternate Faust front-end domain.

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 20](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/7e0b2d94-477e-4913-835b-bb95cc2560a6)

issue.title: Bug: nodeByUri return null in category page
issue.body: ## Applicable Versions - "graphql": "^16.6.0", - "@apollo/client": "^3.6.6" - "@faustwp/cli": "1.1.1" - "@faustwp/core": "1.1.2" - WordPress version: 6.3 ## Captured

issue.title: fix: term_link filter
issue.body:
## Description

This fixes the term_link filter callback to not modify the term link urls for GraphQL requests. 

## Related Issue(s):

fixes: #1613

## Testing

#### BEFORE:

Term uri is absolute in the GraphQL Response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 51 51](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/bd81fe0e-8978-4374-968c-c4c7c76cd6f1)


#### AFTER:

The term uri is relative in the GraphQL response

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 00](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/910f50ec-ae1b-4333-be84-0db538e95a99)

But in the admin UIs the term links are absolute with the alternate Faust front-end domain.

![CleanShot 2023-10-18 at 12 53 20](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1260765/7e0b2d94-477e-4913-835b-bb95cc2560a6)

comment.body:
These tests are failing, and it seems to be due to the `#` in the branch name, which translates to a URL that isn't working well with `npx create-next-app`. 

![image](https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/assets/1254870/103197dd-9894-48e9-859e-154e8b0476b2)

Clicking that link gives me a 404: https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/tree/fix/#1613-term_link_callback

The encoded version works: https://github.com/wpengine/faustjs/tree/fix/%231613-term_link_callback

issue.title: RFC: Next.js App Router support in @faust/blocks package

comment.body: @theodesp looks good to me. As far as I can tell there's no real additional coupling in the type, which means it would be trivial to update `Component` to support a dynamic component if/when the underlying client provider supports them 🙌

issue.title: Automate Pagination Config
issue.body:
Currently Apollo requires a bit of Boilerplate code to configure how to handle pagination on connections. 

When users add new Post Types, Taxonomies or other types of Nodes, they’re not able to query them as connections with Apollo until they get configured. 

I believe Faust should automate this boilerplate so that it “just works”. 

Since WPGraphQL 1.13.0, all connections implement the Connection Interface. 

This means that Faust should be able to use introspection to fetch all connections from the schema and produce a config object that can be passed to Apollo, (similar to how Faust handles getPossibleTypes).  

This would reduce a lot of extra work and confusion from users that don’t realize this extra setup is needed to paginate custom post types, etc.

comment.body: For some context and to save some time for the next person, to configure a new CPT for pagination, simply add the new type to `plugins/RelayStylePaginationPlugin.js` under  `posts: relayStylePagination(),` for example: `posttypename: relayStylePagination(),`
